channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This makes the road very dark by the bridge over Horesbere Brook.

item.title: Glare from Street lighting, 2nd November
item.description:
The glare from the street light comes directly into the house affecting two bedrooms and kitchen. Is it at all possible to put up some sort of light deflector to move light onto street and pavement where it is needed? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 185 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: M5 northbound Jct 10 to jct 9 nothbound has 50 limit signs but NO roadworks, 2nd November
item.description:
M5 northbound Jct 10 to jct 9 nothbound has 50 limit signs but NO roadworks at all for the several miles involved. A wholly unnecessary and frustrating waste of my time and negligent from those responsible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Elmstone Hardwicke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving stones is coming loose and uneven along road, 2nd November
item.description:
Juniper Close. Has really bad, uneven and loose paving stones all along the road. Please note the road is not properly mapped out on the map. It is a close in-between innsworth lane and hannah place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Juniper Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Once again, more rubbish has been fly tipped., 1st November
item.description:
Once again, more rubbish fly tipped next to the fence outside 30 Hicks Beach Road, GL51 0JW. It's been there for over a month now. This is happening on a regular basis!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Hicks Beach Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Large area's of car park, 31st October
item.description:
Large areas of car park, cobbles are loose and lifting when walking over some lift upto 2 inches causing tripping. One area in front of garages very bad and same by storm drains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20 Saint Pauls Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Site being used as litter bin, 30th October
item.description:
The abandoned Suzuki garage is gathering more and more litter. Please could this be cleaned up? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 170-172 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter in Pilley Lane hedgerows, 30th October
item.description:
These hedges particularly by the nursing home are being used as rubbish bins. There are masks, dog poo bags, cans, drinks bottles and even milk bottles strewn throughout them. Please could these be cleaned up; a bin would not be a bad idea!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Pilley Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light phasing, 30th October
item.description:
Westbound traffic turning right off A40 London road into greenway lane and/or ryeworth road are, for no apparent reason - and unlike traffic going straight ahead towards Cheltenham centre - given about a minute to execute its turn before the light goes to red. Would you agree that this rh lane phasing should be changed to match that of the lh lane thereby improving traffic flow and negating the need for drivers switching from lh lane to the rh lane to effectively and illegally jump the latter. If you agree, could a change be effected, please. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 239a London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charletyne Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Vegetation m5 sb causing subsidence, 27th October
item.description:
We have a serious subsidence issue with buildings and concrete cracking and probably enhanced by the drought. But things are definitely moving towards the motorway embankment. The trees are totally overgrown so this is an urgent matter as buildings are likely to collapse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Woodhouse Farm Brockworth Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet
